posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hello Squid, and welcome to the guild!
In a level 20 environment, one does not have enough levels to play with to make an effective arcane spellsword.
A multiclassed caster build will need 15 to 20 levels of the caster class, and that poses some problems with the multiclass rules on your server.
The best you can do if you want a level 20 self buffer, is to play a cleric. The second option is a bard. A third option is the melee mage; a wizard 20. Another idea is to play a Druid, but there the melee focus often is on the shapes.
Multiclassing on your server forces your build down to 15 caster levels, or 13 if you want 3 classes.
Cleric15/X5 and Bard15/X5 are viable, but IMO pure builds will be better.(Perhaps not for Bard).
If you reverse the question, and primarily want a meleer, then Bard may serve well as a minor class to offer tumble UMD, taunt and a song to boost the melee prowess. It may also open up for RDD.
But in that case other "tumble classes" are also available.

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
HipRedux wrote:
Dark fire is the superior cleric buff.  Flame Weapon is the arcane counterpart that does much less damage.
Flame weapon does "1d4 points of fire damage +1 per caster level to a maximum of +10", while Darkfire does "1d6 points of damage, +1 per two caster levels (maximum of +10) of fire damage". Darkfire can do a little more damage, but it needs more levels to reach its full potential.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
If you are willing to settle for Level 4 spells in this concept ( :( )...

Your DivMight damage cannot be resisted as Flame Weapon's can and the damage will crit.  Better to pump CHA as high as reasonable for the advantages (more turn attempts, higher AC and dmg boosts).  Div boost application will not fail during combat like all your other spells will (except for True Strike which has no somatic component).

If you drop the lame Toughness feat for Empower Spell and choose Endurance at Level 2, you can empower Eagle to max +7.  At CHA 18, all you need is CHA +5 on gear to cap CHA at 30 (that's +10 AC and +10 Div dmg!).   What you lose from dropping Toughness you gain back by empowering Endurance and gain a Fort save in addition to the +20 HP. Without empowered abilities, the potential of this build is nerfed.

Instead of ImpInvis, take Shadow Conjuration to get access to Darkness.  Every hit within Darkness cloud will cause sneak damage (@BG 10 that's +3-18 slash).  You get ImpInvis for free from possessing the Faerie Dragon at Src 1 and then later at Src 5 with the pixie.  Whether you dismiss the familiar after the buffing or not for XP penalty reasons is up to you.  Other options are ILMS, Ice Storm, Element shield, Stoneskin... whatever.

If you send your BG summon into a pack of corporeal (living) creatures, NEB spam on your undead summon is easily the most powerful spell in your repertoire.  Keen Edge will be sacrificed, but such is the natural consequence of low-level sorc... repertoire is always severely restrictive.  A wider crit range only factors into combat against lower AC types and does nothing vs. the toughest threats where the AC is near the top of the AB range or dependent on naturals to hit at all.

I think the basic problem in this concept is that you are not using the src strengths... the offensive spells.  Src (or wiz, for that matter) is not much of a self-buffer except for the True Strikes.  Cleric would be far superior.  You'd invest less in STR (because div buffs will more than compensate from the lost AB and dmg), more in WIS and CHA and not be haunted by spell failure.   But you have lots of company.  This isn't the first request for a concept that is impossible to optimize adequately.  You can pretty much depend on losing all PvP encounters except against the clueless inhabiting ther server.

High AB shouldn't be much of a problem for a Fighter-type - it will be boosting AC that may prove more of an issue. There are several ways to overcome it, however. First, you could go DEX-based and use a finessed weapon - the downside is that you'd sacrifice damage for the AC. Second, you could take a self-buffing class, such as Cleric or even Bard - although natural AB will take a hit (pun not intended). RDD would be another alternative, but not only will that hamper AB, it will also mean you have to take Bard or Sorcerer as your third class (and I don't even know if it's an allowed class on your server). DwD might also be an option, if you're happy being a dwarf (and why wouldn't you be?) - as might Barbarian. Plenty to think about!

When you've had a chance to give it some proper mulling over, you'd probably want to raise it as a separate topic here, just to save us from getting confused!

Cheers
